Key Match Events: Phil Salt clobbered Romario Shepherd for three 6s and three 4s in the 16th over
Phil Salt scored 87* and Jonny Bairstow scored 48* in a 97-run partnership
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies captain Rovman Powell leads his team off the field
West Indies opted to revert to the XI that produced previous wins
West Indies' problems started when they were inserted to bat and opener Brandon King retired hurt
England scored 58 from the powerplay and managed the game well
England benefited from a 97-run partnership by Salt and Jonny Bairstow
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies captain Rovman Powell expressed hope that King can 'pull through' to face USA and South Africa
West Indies need to look back and evaluate their performance
West Indies' eight-match winning streak ended with defeat to England
Powell credited Salt for always hurting them and stated that they need to reevaluate their plans
Miscellaneous Highlights: West Indies were 40 without loss when Brandon King was forced to retire hurt with a side strain in the fifth over
West Indies scored 180 for 4 in the first innings
England scored 181 for 2 in the second innings
